name: Substrate consolidation or armoring
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Combines substrate size distribution, embeddedness, and consolidation or armoring to assess pore space and habitat quality.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use a pick test or visual checks to identify surface crusting, cementing, or heavy armoring.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Little to no cementing. Substrate can be individually moved.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Strong bonding with interstitial spaces mostly filled.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Severe crusting or heavy armor with minimal infiltration or habitat.

references: Field pick test or visual checks
document as data gap where field access is limited.
